## Vier vragen bij groei en ontwikkeling

<br> 

::: {.incremental}

### Evalueren

1. Waar staat het kind t.o.v. leeftijdgenoten?
2. Past de recente groei bij de eerdere metingen van het kind?

<br>

### Voorspellen

3. Hoe zal het kind in de toekomst groeien?
4. Geeft deze verwachting aanleiding tot acties nu?

:::

```{r}
#| label: spaghetti-cm
#| echo: false

library(dplyr)
library(plotly)
library(donorloader)
library(bdsreader)
set.seed(seed = 2)
n <- 100
ids <- load_data(dnr = "smocc", element = "time") |> 
  pull(id) |> 
  sample(size = n) |> 
  sort()
df <- load_data(dnr = "smocc", element = "time") |> 
  select(src, id, rec, age, sex, bw, ga, hgt, hgt_z) |> 
  filter(id %in% ids)
shared <- df |> 
  highlight_key(~ id)
base <- plot_ly(shared, 
                color = I("#001571"),
                width = 650, 
                height = 650) |> 
  group_by(id)
cm <- base |> 
  config(displayModeBar = FALSE) |> 
  layout(
    xaxis = list(
      range = list(-0.02, 2.25),
      rangemode = "tozero",
      dtick = 0.25,
      tick0 = 0,
      ticklabelstep = 0.25,
      title = "Leeftijd in jaren",
      zeroline = FALSE),
    yaxis = list(
      range = list(40, 100), 
      title = "Lengte (cm)"
    )
  ) |> 
  group_by(id) |> 
  add_lines(x = ~ age, y = ~ hgt)
cm

# 54088 Kunt niet zien dat start meer dan 1 SD afneemt
# 34077 Prematuur
# 14028 Wanneer is moment van ingrijpen?
# 53094 Toename van 1 SD slecht te zien
```

```{r}
#| label: multipletraces
#| background-color: "grey"
source("R/chart_helpers.R")
xaxis <- list(
  dtick = 0.25,
  range = list(-1/12, 31/12),
  showgrid = TRUE,
  showline = FALSE,
  showticklabels = TRUE, 
  tick0 = -9/12,
  ticktext = as.character(seq(-9, 48, 3)),
  tickvals = seq(-9, 48, 3)/12,
  title = "Leeftijd (maanden)",
  zeroline = FALSE)
yaxis <- list(
  dtick = 1,
  range = list(-4, 4),
  tick0 = 0,
  ticklabelstep = 2,
  title = "Standard Deviation Score (SDS)",
  zeroline = TRUE,
  zerolinecolor = "#00AB6688",
  zerolinewidth = 2)
yname_colors <- c("#FF0000BB", "#0072B2", "#56B4E9", "#763A7E", "#33B882", "#E69F00")
# plotly config
config_list <- list(
  displayModeBar = FALSE,
  displaylogo = FALSE)

# target data
fn <- system.file("extdata", "bds_v2.0", "smocc", "Laura_S.json", package = "jamesdemodata")
target <- bdsreader::read_bds(fn)
data <- target[["xyz"]]

# add labels for legends and hovertext
data <- add_labels(data)

# create plot
fig <- plot_ly(width = 1300, height = 800) %>%
  config(displayModeBar = FALSE, displaylogo = FALSE) %>%
  layout(paper_bgcolor = "#F7F7F7F7",
         plot_bgcolor = "white",
         xaxis = xaxis,
         yaxis = yaxis,
         shapes = list(
           fillcolor = "#00AB6688",
           line = list(width = 0),
           opacity = 0.1,
           type = "rect",
           x0 = 0, x1 = 30,
           y0 = -2, y1 = 2
         ),
         legend = list(
           bgcolor = "transparent",
           x = 0.995,
           y = 1,
           xanchor = "right"
         )) |>
  add_trace(
    color = ~yname_label,
    colors = yname_colors,
    data = data,
    hoverinfo = 'text',
    line = list(width = 2.5),
    marker = list(size = 10),
    mode = "lines+markers",
    text = ~paste0('</br>', yname,
                   '</br>', round(y, digits = 1), ' ', yname_unit,
                   ' (', format(z, nsmall = 2),
                   '; P', pf, ')'),
    type = "scatter",
    x = ~age,
    y = ~z,
    xaxis = "x"
  )

# define traces visible at startup
visible <- list(hgt = "legendonly", wgt = "legendonly", wfh = FALSE,
                bmi = FALSE, hdc = "legendonly", dsc = "legendonly")
fig <- set_trace_visibility(fig, visible)
```


## Signalering aan de hand van richtlijnen {background-color="#F7F7F7F7"  visibility="hidden"}

```{r}
library(donorloader)
library(growthscreener)

all_ids <- load_data(dnr = "smocc")$child$id
set.seed(1)
n <- 50
ids <- sample(all_ids, n)

codes <- vector("list", length(ids))
names(codes) <- ids
for (i in seq_along(ids)) {
  js <- export_as_bds_from_donorloader(dnr = "smocc", ids = ids[i], path = "tmp")
  tgt <- bdsreader::read_bds(paste0("tmp/", ids[i], ".json"))
  codes[[i]] <- screen_curves_tgt(tgt)
}
# codes
# 15171, 14009, 11025, 34102
# gewicht (2045): 13035, 10046, 53165
# lengte (1077): 51132, 15214
```

## Signalering aan de hand van richtlijnen {background-color="#F7F7F7F7"}

```{r}
selected <- c(15171, 14009, 11025, 34102)
target <- bdsreader::read_bds(paste0("tmp/", selected[1], ".json"))
data <- target[["xyz"]]
data <- add_labels(data)
data$hit <- 0
data[2, "hit"] <- 1
data[14, "hit"] <- 2

# create plot
fig <- plot_ly(width = 1300, height = 800) %>%
  config(displayModeBar = FALSE, displaylogo = FALSE) %>%
  layout(paper_bgcolor = "#F7F7F7F7",
         plot_bgcolor = "white",
         xaxis = xaxis,
         yaxis = yaxis,
         shapes = list(
           fillcolor = "#00AB6688",
           line = list(width = 0),
           opacity = 0.1,
           type = "rect",
           x0 = 0, x1 = 30,
           y0 = -2, y1 = 2
         ),
         legend = list(
           bgcolor = "transparent",
           x = 0.995,
           y = 1,
           xanchor = "right"
         )) |>
  add_trace(
    color = ~yname_label,
    colors = yname_colors,
    data = data,
    hoverinfo = 'text',
    line = list(width = 2.5),
    marker = list(size = 10),
    mode = "lines+markers",
    text = ~paste0('</br>', yname,
                   '</br>', round(y, digits = 1), ' ', yname_unit,
                   ' (', format(z, nsmall = 2),
                   '; P', pf, ')'),
    type = "scatter",
    x = ~age,
    y = ~z,
    xaxis = "x"
  ) |> 
  add_markers(
    color = ~yname_label,
    colors = yname_colors,
    data = data[data$hit == 1, ],
    symbol = I(24),
    size = I(1000),
    stroke = I("red"),
    span = I(1),
    text = ~paste0('</br>Lengte toename</br>1077'),
    x = ~age,
    y = ~z,
  ) |> 
  add_markers(
    color = ~yname_label,
    colors = yname_colors,
    data = data[data$hit == 2, ],
    symbol = I(25),
    stroke = I("blue"),
    span = I(1),
    text = ~paste0('</br>Gewicht afname</br>2075'),
    size = I(1000),
    x = ~age,
    y = ~z,
  )

# define traces visible at startup
visible <- list(hgt = "legendonly", wgt = "legendonly", wfh = FALSE,
                bmi = FALSE, hdc = "legendonly", dsc = "legendonly")
fig <- set_trace_visibility(fig, visible)

fig
```
